titleInfo.title: Aerial photograph of North Nashville, ca. 1968

mods.identifier: p-0020 â€“ Nash aerial, interstate area

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: Aerial photograph of North Nashville in the Buena Vista neighborhood, looking northwest, circa 1968, taken by Metro Photographer, William M. King. Photograph shows a wooded residential area with Buena Vista Park in the upper middle of the image, and what is likely Cumberland Field in the upper right. The large building in the center of the image is the St. Cecilia Motherhouse, and North High School can be identified in the upper left corner by its smokestack. Streets identified in the photograph include Clay St. and 8th Ave. North Not marked but visible in the image are Coffee St. running parallel to Clay St. at the bottom of the photo, and 6th Ave. North which can be seen branching from Coffee St towards Clay. 7th Ave. North runs parallel next to 6th Ave. before connecting with Clay, and 5th Ave. North can be identified as the rightmost street that is still clearly visible through the tree line. Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 photograph : b & w ; 8 x 10 in.
mods.accessCondition: U.S. and international copyright laws protect this digital content, which is provided for educational purposes only and may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed for any other purpose without written permission.
